Pre-Game Insights: France had a disappointing start to the Nations League campaign and will hope to find better luck on Monday.
Despite reaching the semi-finals of Euro 2024, France’s national football team were awful to watch as the level of performance that the squad displayed was shameful as a collective.
Belgium’s national football team also had an underwhelming UEFA Euro campaign this summer but have started the Nations League on a strong note.
They are coming off a comfortable 3-1 win over Israel in their opening game of the competition.
Belgium has lost each of their last three meetings with Les Blues in all competitions.
Real Madrid players Aurelien Tchouameni and Ferland Mendy withdrew from the French squad due to injuries.
Defender Loïc Badé’ has sustained a knee injury and has returned to his club Sevilla.
Belgium’s record goalscorer Romelu Lukaku is a notable absentee from the squad.
Arsenal forward Leandro Trossard missed out of the competition despite being a regular in the Euro 2024.
Lois Openda is expected to lead the attack and will be supported by the electric Jeremy Doku.
